title: Nenad Vukčević
text:
Nenad Vukčević (born 25 November 1974) is a <a href="Montenegrins%20%28ethnic%20group%29">Montenegrin</a> former <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player and current manager who played as a <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29">forward</a> for clubs in FR Yugoslavia, Greece and Sweden. He is currently the manager of <a href="FK%20Podgorica">FK Podgorica</a>.
Playing career.
Born in <a href="Podgorica">Titograd</a>, <a href="SR%20Montenegro">SR Montenegro</a>, Vukčević began his career playing for local side <a href="FK%20Budu%C4%87nost%20Podgorica">FK Budućnost Podgorica</a>. He would also play for <a href="FK%20Spartak%20Zlatibor%20Voda">FK Spartak Subotica</a>, before joining <a href="Greek%20Superleague">Greek Superleague</a> side <a href="Panachaiki">Panachaiki F.C.</a> in 1999.
He spent four seasons in the Greek top flight with Panachaiki, making 100 league appearances for the club.
Managerial career.
Late in his playing career, Vukčević was a player-coach for <a href="FK%20Kom">FK Kom</a>. Later, he joined the staff of <a href="FK%20Budu%C4%87nost%20Podgorica">FK Budućnost Podgorica</a>, and became the club's caretaker co-manager in 2010.
After several year in the staff of <a href="FK%20Budu%C4%87nost%20Podgorica">FK Budućnost Podgorica</a>, he was appointed as the manager of the club in July 2013 following the departure of <a href="Radislav%20Dragicevic">Radislav Dragicevic</a>. He left the club in March 2014. 
In June 2016, he became the manager of <a href="FK%20Kom">FK Kom</a> which lasted until March 2017. On 10 January 2019, he was appointed as the manager of <a href="FK%20Rudar%20Pljevlja">FK Rudar Pljevlja</a>.
On 25 September 2019, Vukčević was appointed manager of <a href="OFK%20Petrovac">Petrovac</a>.
